name: Cone Dodgers
description:
Cone Dodgers is a prototype of an autocross game featuring multiple courses. Drive well and earn a medal on a course to unlock the next.  Each course is more challenging that the previous. Scoring follows traditional autocross standards.  Hitting a cone adds two (2) seconds to your total time.  Going the wrong direction around a course element results in a DNF (did-not-finish, or did-not-follow course).  

Although this can be played in a web browser, your best experience will be to download the game and run from your local PC. The PC build offers support for keyboard, gamepad, and steering wheel controls.  The web build may not recognize a steering wheel controller.

This is a prototype, and as such I welcome your feedback and suggestions for features that should be included in a final game.  Here is the short list of what I have planned for the future of this project:

  • Multiple cars including FWD, RWD, and AWD drivetrains.
  • A thorough tutorial sequence.
  • A full regional season with multiple courses.
  • A full divisional season with multiple courses and two-day scoring.
  • Two-day scoring for two national-style courses.
  • User-defined input key binding.
  • Inclusion of driver aids and suspension management.
